Usually, the default umask is 022, so when creating a file, the permissions are calculated like this: 0666 & ~022 = 0644
Similarly, umask 077 results in 0600 for files and 0700 for directories.
All the numbers are in octal, by the way.
The default umask for normal logins is set in /etc/login.defs (but it's often overriden by /etc/profile or even ~/.profile)
You could open Python, for example, and use oct( 0777 & ~027 ) to calculate it.
And remember that files will never be executable by default.
